channel.title: math.KT updates on arXiv.org
channel.description: math.KT updates on the arXiv.org e-print archive.

item.title: Some remarks on Quillen's D\'evissage theorem
item.description: arXiv:2505.13260v2 Announce Type: replace Abstract: In this paper we give a different proof of Quillen's D\'evissage theorem using Barwick's theorem of the heart. The key ingredient is a certain short exact sequence of dg categories, which is closely related with the Auslander-type construction for nilpotent extensions which was used in the papers of Kuznetsov-Lunts \cite{KL15}, Land-Tamme \cite{LT19} and the author \cite{E20}.
item.dc:creator: Alexander I. Efimov

item.title: Localising invariants in derived bornological geometry
item.description: arXiv:2505.15750v2 Announce Type: replace Abstract: We study several categories of analytic stacks relative to the category of bornological modules over a Banach ring. When the underlying Banach ring is a nonarchimedean valued field, this category contains derived rigid analytic spaces as a full subcategory. When the underlying field is the complex numbers, it contains the category of derived complex analytic spaces. In the second part of the paper, we consider localising invariants of rigid categories associated to bornological algebras. The main results in this part include Nisnevich descent for derived analytic spaces and a version of the Grothendieck-Riemann-Roch Theorem for derived dagger analytic spaces over an arbitrary Banach ring.
item.dc:creator: Jack Kelly, Devarshi Mukherjee

item.title: A Motivic Riemann-Roch Theorem for Deligne-Mumford Stacks
item.description: arXiv:2412.05071v2 Announce Type: replace-cross Abstract: We develop a motivic cohomology theory, representable in the Voevodsky's triangulated category of motives, for smooth separated Deligne-Mumford stacks and show that the resulting higher Chow groups are canonically isomorphic to the higher $K$-theory of such stacks. This generalises the Grothendieck-Riemann-Roch theorem to the category of smooth Deligne-Mumford stacks.
item.dc:creator: Utsav Choudhury, Neeraj Deshmukh, Amit Hogadi
